thread.title: Police Release Surveillance Video in Circulator Murder Suspect
thread.title_full: Police Release Surveillance Video in Circulator Murder Suspect

author: CBS Baltimore
title: Police Release Surveillance Video in Circulator Murder Suspect
text:
Police Release Surveillance Video in Circulator Murder Suspect March 9, 2017 11:09 PM Filed Under: Baltimore City Police Department , Charm City Circulator , Murder 
BALTIMORE (WJZ)â€“ Baltimore Police have released surveillance video Thursday from the murder of a 26-year-old man on a Charm City Circulator bus. 
At approximately 2:50 p.m. Wednesday, officers responded to the 200 block of N. Broadway Street at Gough Street for a shooting. 
Officers found the victim on the Charm City Circulator Bus, suffering from gunshot wounds to the stomach. The victim was transported to an area hospital where he died. 
The shooting suspect has been described as an unknown black male who was wearing a black hoodie, black pants and black shoes with white soles. That suspect ran east on Gough Street towards the Perkins Homes. 
Anyone with information regarding this shooting is asked to call detectives at (410) 396-2100, Text a Tip to 443-902-4824 or call Metro Crime Stoppers at 1-866-7LOCKUP.
